titlStmt.titl: International survey on health and health care, 2011, Norwegian part of ISSP

prodStmt.copyright: Copyright (C) 2011 Norwegian Social Science Data Services

docSrc.biblCit: XML Data Documentation for "[Title, (month), year]". 1st XML-edition, NSD Bergen, [Year]

titlStmt.titl: International survey on health and health care, 2011, Norwegian part of ISSP

prodStmt.copyright: Copyright (C) 2011 Norwegian Social Science Data Services

serStmt.serName: International Social Survey Program (ISSP), Norwegian part
serStmt.serInfo: ISSP develops and coordinates annual surveys in their member countries, and the topics for research are repeated at intervals of a few years. The " health and health care" survey was conducted for the first time in Norway in 2011. The objective of the surveys is to create an empirical foundation for studying health and health care.

verStmt.notes: Original data from TNS Gallup are documented and prepared, first NSD-version.

citation.biblCit: "International survey on health and health care, 2011, Norwegian part of ISSP". Data collected by TNS Gallup. First NSD edition, Bergen 2012.

stdyInfo.abstract:
This survey is conducted on the basis of the research work in "The International Social Survey Programme" (ISSP). ISSP is an international organization where members develop and coordinate annual surveys, mainly in the fields of political science and sociology. The topics of the surveys vary, but topics are replicated every few years so that it is possible to measure the changes in patterns of behavior and attitudes over time and differences between countries and cultures.
In 1989, the Norwegian Social Science Data Services (NSD) became member of the ISSP and NSD has since been responsible for conducting the survey in Norway.
In 2011, the goal was to collect data on health and health care.

sumDscr.universe: Persons residing in Norway in the ages of 19-78, in 2011.

dataColl.sampProc:
The sample has consisted of 3800 units.
The primary sample was drawn from the Central Person Register as a simple, random sample of persons residing in Norway, in the age of 18-79 years. TNS Gallup sent out and registered the self-completion questionnaires. Respondents were also offered to answer on a web-based questionnaire developed by NSD. 489 of the respondents used the web survey.
Gross sample: 3800 persons Net sample: 1834 persons Response rate: 48,26%

setAvail.avlStatus: Data are freely accessible for researchers and students at universities and colleges.
setAvail.collSize: One data file; different formats can be made.

useStmt.restrctn: Data are freely accessible for researchers and students at universities and colleges.
useStmt.citReq: Users are obliged to refer to producer and distributor of the data by writing the following in forewords or footnotes in eventual publications: “(Some of) the data applied in the analysis in this publication are based on "International survey on health and health care, 2011, Norwegian part of ISSP". The data are provided by TNS Gallup and NSD, and prepared and made available by the Norwegian Social Science Data Services (NSD). Neither TNS Gallup nor NSD are responsible for the analyses/interpretation of the data presented here."
useStmt.deposReq: Access to data is given on the condition that NSD gets three copies, alternatively a PDF-file, of eventual reports that are written on the basis of the data. This to ensure best possible information of the use of data we distribute.
useStmt.disclaimer: Neither TNS Gallup nor NSD are responsible for the analyses/interpretation of the data presented here.

var.name: v023
var.labl: OPROYK Surgery first: Smoker or non-smoker

qstn.qstnLit: Suppose two equally sick people need the same heart operation. One does not smoke, the other is a heavy smoker . In your opinion who should get the operation first?

catgry.labl: Their smoking habits should make no difference

var.name: v024
var.labl: OPALD Surgery first: 30-year-old or 70-year-old

qstn.qstnLit: Now, suppose two other equally sick people need the same heart operation. One is aged 30, the other 70. In your opinion who should get the operation first?

catgry.labl: Their ages should make no difference

var.name: v025
var.labl: OPBARN Surgery first: have small children or do not have young children

qstn.qstnLit: Now, suppose two other equally sick people need the same heart operation. One has young children, the other does not have young children. In your opinion who should get the operation first?

catgry.labl: The one who has young children
The one who has no young children
Having young children should make no difference

var.name: v099
var.labl: TRSAMF Located particular religion or denomination

qstn.qstnLit: Do you belong to a particular religion or belief, and if so, what?

catgry.labl: Other philosofical association, for example Norwegian Humanist Association

var.name: v100
var.labl: RELMOTE How often attend religious services or other religious ways (except for weddings, funerals, baptisms, etc.)

qstn.qstnLit: How often do you attend religious services or other religious meetings? Do not include weddings, funerals, baptisms, etc.

catgry.labl: Two or three times a month

var.name: v101
var.labl: SKALA10 Placed on the social ladder: top-bottom scale

qstn.qstnLit: In our society, there are groups that are more or less near the top of the social ladder and groups that are more or less near the bottom. Below is a scale that runs from top to bottom. Where would you place yourself on this scale?

var.name: v102
var.labl: STEMVALG Voted in last general election

qstn.qstnLit: Did you vote in the last parliamentary elections in 2009?

catgry.labl: Did not have the right to vote

var.name: v103
var.labl: PARTIVLG Which party you vote for in the last election

qstn.qstnLit: Which party you vote for in the last election?

var.name: v104
var.labl: FLDFDT Were your parents born in Norway

qstn.qstnLit: Were your parents born in Norway?

catgry.labl: One of them born in Norway
None of them born in Norway

var.name: v105
var.labl: PERS18 Persons 18 years and over, including yourself, living the common household

qstn.qstnLit:
Including yourself, how many people live to normal in your household, and in which age groups benefit household members themselves?
... A. Number of adults 18 years and older, including yourself (one number in each square).

var.name: v106
var.labl: BRNSK Number of children 6-17 years living in the common household

qstn.qstnLit:
Including yourself, how many people live to normal in your household, and in which age groups benefit household members themselves?
... B. Number of children aged 6-17 years.

var.name: v107
var.labl: BRNUSK Number of children under 6 years old living in the household to normal

qstn.qstnLit:
Including yourself, how many people live to normal in your household, and in which age groups benefit household members themselves?
... C. Number of children under 6 years.

var.name: v108
var.labl: ANTHUSST Number of people in all that normaly lives in your household

qstn.qstnLit:
Including yourself, how many people live to normal in your household, and in which age groups benefit household members themselves?
... D. In total, including yourself.

var.name: v109
var.labl: INNTEKT Specific gross annual income before taxes and deductions including pension, social security, subsidiary income, interest income, etc., but not loans. 1 000.

qstn.qstnLit: Before taxes and other deductions, about how big is your gross annual income? with pension, social security, subsidiary income, interest income, etc., but not loans.

var.name: v110
var.labl: HHINNT Household gross annual income before taxes and deductions including pension, social security, subsidiary income, interest income, etc., but not loans. 1 000.

qstn.qstnLit: Household gross annual income before taxes and deductions including pension, social security, subsidiary income, interest income, etc., but not loans. (In 1 000 NOK.)

var.labl: SIVSTAT Current marital status

qstn.qstnLit: Current marital status.

var.name: v112
var.labl: BOSTED Location type

qstn.qstnLit: Location type.

catgry.labl: A suburb to, or on the outskirts of a big city

var.labl: LANDSDEL Regionally

qstn.qstnLit: Regionally.

var.labl: mode Answer types
